title: Birds of Prey
description: Do you know what a martial eagle eats? How about how fast a peregrine falcon travels? In Birds of Prey, readers will learn about the different types of raptors and their fascinating features. Vivid photographs and charts filled with interesting facts will teach readers about owls, falcons, hawks, eagles, kites, and vultures. This book can be used to teach students how to compare and contrast as well as the proper use of prepositional phrases.
highFrequencyWords: birds of prey, climates, habitats, hooked, predators, prey, sensitive, talons, vision
reviewWords: Use of vocabulary lessons requires a subscription to VocabularyA-Z.com.
comprehension: Prepositional Phrases                : Recognize and use prepositional phrases
awareness: Synonyms and Antonyms                : Identify and use synonyms and antonyms
phonics:
Promote higher-order thinking for small groups
or whole class
